author: chucklu
body:
I have a file with extension .ps1, when I open it, it was opened by the default powershell in win10.
But I want to switch the default program for .ps1 to the powershell 6.0 ,when I try to do that ,the COM Surrogate stucked.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3004057/30998505-a9e7668c-a501-11e7-9c5d-c086fa6588e7.png)

The default version of powershell
```powershell
PS T:\> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.0.10586.1045
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.10586.1045
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.6> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.6
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.10586
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: chucklu
comments.body: The problem disappeared after I upgrade the powershell to latest version.

title: Stuck when I try to set the file with extension .ps1‘s propertiy open with
